english: to seal; to confer (a title/fief); measure word for letters; to enclose

etymology.type: Ideogrammic compound (會意/会意); phono-semantic compound (形聲/形声)
etymology.description: phonetic: 丰 + semantic: 土, 寸 — mark boundaries by planting trees.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a seedling with earth and a hand, evoking staking out and enclosing land by planting posts. 丰 cues the fēng sound, while 土 and 寸 contribute the sense of ground and the manual act of sealing or conferring territory.

examples.chinese: 我寄出了一封信(我寄出了一封信)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jì chū le yì fēng xìn.

examples.chinese: 警察封锁了道路(警察封鎖了道路)。
examples.english: The police sealed off the road.

examples.chinese: 国王封他为侯爵(國王封他為侯爵)。
examples.english: The king conferred on him the title of marquis.
